document_title: Orchitis: Causes, signs, diagnosis and prevention
subsection_content:
Orchitis rarely affects fertility in patients. Furthermore, orchitis, if treated early and properly, can be completely cured.
However, patients need to pay attention to treatment as soon as any symptoms appear. Although orchitis does not affect the patient's urinary system health, orchitis also causes certain inconveniences in the patient's daily activities.
Pain in the testicles, groin area and scrotal skin are the main causes of discomfort, and more seriously, lead to stress and decreased mental health in the patient. In addition, if orchitis persists or recurs many times, it will cause the infection to spread. Pathogenic bacteria will spread to nearby organs and cause infection. This leads to other complications such as:
Abscess in the scrotum; Accumulation of fluid in the scrotum; Testicular atrophy; Chronic orchitis; Sepsis
